metadata.title: CVE-2020-11612 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: The ZlibDecoders in Netty 4.1.x before 4.1.46 allow for unbounded memoryallocation while decoding a ZlibEncoded byte stream. An attacker could senda large ZlibEncoded byte stream to the Netty server, forcing the server toallocate all of its free memory to a single decoder.

criterions.comment: netty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
